result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin T. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be determined.  Joint and several with Darnell Cleveland.
*12/3/2015  $650.00 to be paid to Fannie S.  To be collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Pay all costs, restitution and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

12-23-2020/ Judge Milton Childs   
The Court ordered that the JOC dshall be amended to reflect that the defendant is to  serve his sentence on case no. 15CF1170 before he serves his consecutive sentences in case nos. 14CF4071 and 15CF209.
****
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving nine (9) years Initial Confinement in cases 14CF4071, 15CF209 and 15CF1170.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No ilegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Fannie S. and coactor Darnell Cleveland.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a  DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

records.addlTxt: filed.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.

The state has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 9 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim:  Fannie S. and co-actor:  Darnell Cleveland.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution to be determined.  Restitution is joint and several with Darnell Cleveland.  

- The Court ordered defendant to submit a  DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, restitution, and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 9 years initial confinement in cases 14CF4071, 15CF209 and 15CF1170.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Order to Produce

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Parties requests new date.  Case adjourned for status conference and projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  Ronald Dague for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Kevin T. Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Public Defender Office had case calendared for the p.m. calendar.  CCAP and file reflected case calendared for the a.m.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:   FANNIE S.  AND CO-DEFENDANTS: MATTHEW MOORE, DARNELL CLEVELAND.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
